     441             : /* hashable tuples, as proposed in
     442             :  * http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7110301/generic-hash-for-tuples-in-unordered-map-unordered-set
     443             :  */
     444             : namespace
     445             : {
     446             : 
     447             :   inline size_t hash_combiner(size_t left, size_t right) // replacable
     448             :   {
     449             :     return left ^ right;
     450             :   }
     451             : 
     452             :   template <size_t index, class... types>
     453             :   size_t
     454             :   hash_impl<index, types...>::operator()(size_t a,
     455             :                                          const std::tuple<types...> &t) const
     456             :   {
     457             :     using nexttype =
     458             :         typename std::tuple_element<index, std::tuple<types...>>::type;
     459             :     hash_impl<index - 1, types...> next;
     460             :     size_t b = std::hash<nexttype>()(std::get<index>(t));
     461             :     return next(hash_combiner(a, b), t);
     462             :   }
     463             : 
     464             :   template <class... types>
     465             :   size_t hash_impl<0, types...>::operator()(size_t a,
     466             :                                             const std::tuple<types...> &t) const
     467             :   {
     468             :     using nexttype = typename std::tuple_element<0, std::tuple<types...>>::type;
     469             :     size_t b = std::hash<nexttype>()(std::get<0>(t));
     470             :     return hash_combiner(a, b);
     471             :   }
     472             : } // namespace
     473             : 
     474             : /* specialize std::hash */

     485             :   template <typename T, size_t N, class V>
     486             :   size_t hash<pythonic::types::array_base<T, N, V>>::operator()(
